type.name: org.gradle.api.artifacts.result.DependencyResult
type.description: * An edge in the dependency graph. Provides information about the origin of the dependency and the requested component. * * @see ResolutionResult

method.name: getFrom
method.description: * Returns the origin of the dependency. * * @return the origin of the dependency

method.name: getRequested
method.description:
*

Returns the requested component. * *

The return type is declared as an opaque {@link org.gradle.api.artifacts.component.ComponentSelector}, however the selector may also implement one of the following interfaces:

* *
    *
  • {@link org.gradle.api.artifacts.component.ProjectComponentSelector} for those dependencies that request a component from some other project in the current build.
    • *
  • {@link org.gradle.api.artifacts.component.ModuleComponentSelector} for those dependencies that request a component to be found in some repository.
    • *
* @return the requested component

property.name: from
property.description: * Returns the origin of the dependency. * * @return the origin of the dependency

property.name: requested
property.description:
*

Returns the requested component. * *

The return type is declared as an opaque {@link org.gradle.api.artifacts.component.ComponentSelector}, however the selector may also implement one of the following interfaces:

* *
    *
  • {@link org.gradle.api.artifacts.component.ProjectComponentSelector} for those dependencies that request a component from some other project in the current build.
    • *
  • {@link org.gradle.api.artifacts.component.ModuleComponentSelector} for those dependencies that request a component to be found in some repository.
    • *
* @return the requested component
